name: Courtyard by Marriott Montreal Airport

reviews.text: This hotel is about 10 minutes to the airport but it's not "way out" like lots of hotel airports. There are several restaurants and a movie theater within walking distance so it's very convenient. It's right off Highway 40 but if your room faces the highway it can be a little loud. If you are a light sleeper, you definitely want to get a room on the other side (and always travel with earplugs).
reviews.title: Good stay, convenient location

reviews.text: Not much more to say about this hotel that hasn't already been said. We really enjoyed our stay. Room was nice and spacious, the bathroom was big and immaculate and the service was excellent. Internet was super fast. Was only a 5 minute drive to the Namur Metro Station which we took into downtown Montreal. Can't say enough good things about this hotel, stay here, you won't regret it.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel, All the Reviews are accurate

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights while in town for business. I've stayed in downtown Montreal before, but since my meetings were near the airport I didn't feel a need to be downtown on this trip. This was probably the best Courtyard I've ever stayed at. No matter where you were in the hotel (lobby, business center, restaurant, bar, etc.) it had a comfortable atmosphere and the staff was very friendly. The hotel shuttle was quick and convenient. There are plenty of restaurants in walking distance and only 1 to 2 blocks away. There's also a movie theater and a large shopping mall in walking distance. It was raining when I was there so I was mostly confined to my room. The room was average size, but due to the unique layout it felt spacious. The bed was comfortable and so was the sofa for watching TV. The only thing that would have made this an excellent rating for me would be the analog TV signal. I don't understand why most of these hotels are upgrading to nice flat screen TV's but not upgrading to a digital signal. All this does is magnify the fuzzy picture. If I wasn't in the hotel for most of the evening, this would not have been a big deal. I will definitely be back the next time I need to stay close to the Montreal Airport.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Near YUL Airport

reviews.text: From the staff, helpful and professional, to the rooms-modern, and nicely appointed with high-end finishes and fixtures, to the heavenly chocolate and ice cream dessert, this hotel is top-notch.
reviews.title: Everything is first class

reviews.text: The hotel is well thought out and executed. Located on the airport property, no van hassles, and public transportation; train and bus will easily get you into the city.
reviews.title: Near to airport and Mall

reviews.text: First time at this hotel - will return if possible. Reserved on Priceline - paid 50% off room rate - full rate is too much. Very very nice hotel - helpful staff. Room is big enough with lots of pillows (5) per bed. Heard some nose from next room, otherwise a very good sleep. Breakfast buffet is good for $15. Not much in walking distance - shopping centre & restaurants about 3 blocks away. Need a car to get around. 3 high-speed internet terminals near the front deck - in a large room which is nicer than the usual small converted cupboard.
reviews.title: Very nice & clean with great staff - but you need a car

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it is clean, but not that convenient for since i am interested in visiting the city
reviews.title: clean, but not very convenient

reviews.text: and the price is not bad while bidding from priceline for 50 bucks per night
reviews.title: This is one of the finest hotels I have...

reviews.text: parking is also free
reviews.title: Nice place, far from downtown

reviews.text: This is one of the finest hotels I have stayed at in a long time. From the bus driver to the maintenance man this hotel is run with precision. The hotel is spotless with not a crumb on the floor in the lobby, halls, work out room, pool, laundry room or my guest room. Frankly I haven't ever seen a hotel so clean. On my first night my hair dryer failed. I mentioned this to a maintenace man I ran into in the hall and he immediately fixed it. In the lobby the mouse for one of the customer pc work stations was not working well... I mentioned this and it was immediately fixed. The team at this Courtyard have a lot of pride and are well trained.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, would definately stay again!

reviews.text: My son and I were on a 2 day vacation of Montreal. The staff at the Montreal Marriott were 2nd to none in seeing to our every need. Our room was pristine, with loads of storage (closets, drawers, shelves). It had a mini fridge and coffee maker, large flat screen tv & wifi. The bathroom resembled an elegant spa one would see at a resort with an over-sized tub/shower. The bed included a down comforter with extra pillows. I felt completly safe at the hotel because of the security of the rooms. The gentlemen at the valet service were extremely friendly, helpful and FAST! I never had to wait more than 2 minutes for them to bring my car. I would hardly know I was next to an airport because one can barely hear the planes. I will absolutely tell anyone to stay here and I plan to return and stay there again. Thank you Montreal Airport Marriott for a great stay and a chance to make a lasting memory for my son who had never been to Montreal before!
reviews.title: Impecable attention to every detail!

reviews.text: We stayed here on our way back to Toronto from down east last weekend. The check in was smooth and went without a hitch although there was no one there to help with our baggage and the cart etc.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.text: The room was larger than most, so was the washroom. The entire room was modern and clean. The beds were comfortable. Even though we were close to the airport, we were not bothered by the aircraft flying past.
reviews.title: Extended weekend made enjoyable by having space in our room!

reviews.text: We used the pool and hot tub, again, no problem.
reviews.title: 3c's! Comfortable, CLEAN and convenient

reviews.text: We would consider this hotel again, unless we were sticking around Montreal to actually see the city. In that case, we'd look for something closer to the downtown as this hotel is a bit of a drive from the downtown core.
reviews.title: Very Nice Place near Restaurants and a Movie Theatre

reviews.text: Clean modern hotel with a complimentary shuttle service which is great for business travellers as it saves the hassle of taxis etc. It is located neat to place vertu shopping mall and also a number of restaurants and a cinema also not too far from the airport. If you are going to see Montreal however stay in the city as its a bit remote, as I was on business in the area so it was fine. I ate in the restaurant one evening and I was the only diner and the food was just about OK no culinary delights to be found here. The morning breakfast was pretty much standard fare but the cooked food was again not great I did manage to supplement it was fresh fruit and yoghurts and I wish they had shown instructions how to use the waffle maker!! Staff were bi-lingual and very courteous. The computer in the foyer for flight check-in was great and the free wifi was sufficiently fast. I would stay here again but perhaps avoid the food.
reviews.title: Great Location for Business

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were lost, looking for another hotel where we had reservations. Rocco at the front desk was enormously helpful in pointing us in the right direction and printing out directions and a map. Gave us his card if we needed follow up. If only all in the hospitality industry could be so customer-oriented!
reviews.title: Very hospitable front desk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Courtyard Marriott Montreal Airport many times. It is a relatively new property, spotless, with very clean and spacious rooms, comfortable beds, friendly staff and free internet. My wife and I love staying at this property.
reviews.title: A great hotel. but not for tourism in Montreal

reviews.text: There is nothing negative about this property. But, it is located in the north end of the city, in the suburban area called St. Laurent. My wife and I are ex-Montrealers and we stay at this hotel most times when we visit relatives who live in the immediate area. But, we hardly ever go downtown and are not in Montreal for tourism. If your visit takes you to the north end, by all means, stay at this hotel. If you are in Montreal for tourism, to explore the city, then find a property downtown.
reviews.title: Exactly what you want from a Courtyard and more

reviews.text: I was in Montréal for the Formula One Grand Prix last year and stayed at this hotel. I know it's been a while but I had forgotten to write a review and looking back I really wanted to compliment the hotel staff for making our stay excellent. The hotel is close to the airport so there is nothing really much to do right around the hotel but this is to be expected as it is mainly a business hotel. There are some good restaurants right nearby including a couple bars and a sports bar. I had never been to Montréal and recommend it to everybody after going. It is a great town! Back to the hotel, all of the staff at front desk were very friendly and helpful. We had an accessibility issue at the racetrack with my motorized wheelchair and the hotel staff lent us a manual chair for the entire weekend. This truly saved our trip. We had breakfast every morning at the hotel's restaurant and it was very good and reasonably priced. The wait staff were also very friendly (I'm sure it didn't hurt that they were mostly Latin as am I. A little Spanish in Montréal goes a long way apparently). We stayed a couple extra days after the races in order to enjoy the city and one of those days we met the hotel's general manager recommended we drive to Mont Tremblant. The drive was a little over an hour and was definitely worth it, this is a beautiful little town up in the mountains. After doing some shopping the last day, I had purchased an item which turns out wouldn't fit in my luggage. Again, the helpful general manager made sure to send it by mail to my house. We were out of the hotel almost the entire day every day and without exception, our rooms were impeccable every time we returned. Physically, the hotel is what you would expect of any Courtyard but it's the staff that makes this property stand out. I would recommend it to anybody.
reviews.title: Clean and nice hotel!

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Montreal Airport Hotel Montreal
description: Finally a Courtyard by Marriott at the Montreal-Trudeau International Airport. The Marriott Courtyard Montreal Airport offers more than your regular airport hotel. In this unique location off Transcanada Highway in the Business District of Saint-Laurent, it shares many services with the Residence Inn Montreal Airport that is linked to it, like a fine restaurant & bar. These hotels aren't just physically linked but also share the same passion, your satisfaction!
